description: Multi-layer illegal operations with simple crimes and complex multi-stage criminal enterprises

simple_illegal_acts.name: Harvest Buffer Zone Violation
simple_illegal_acts.description: Cut trees within 30m of streams to maximize volume
simple_illegal_acts.story: Your crew supervisor suggests 'adjusting' the buffer zone boundaries. Those extra trees near the creek are worth $180K, but violating riparian buffers is a serious offense.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Exceed Cut Block Boundaries
simple_illegal_acts.description: Harvest additional trees beyond approved cut block limits
simple_illegal_acts.story: GPS shows your crew is approaching the cut block boundary, but there's premium timber just 50m beyond. Extending the harvest would add $220K profit.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Underreport Harvest Volumes
simple_illegal_acts.description: Scale logs as smaller than actual to reduce stumpage fees
simple_illegal_acts.story: The scaling supervisor hints that reported volumes could be 'conservative'. Underreporting 20% of harvest volume saves massive stumpage fees.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Bypass Archaeological Assessment
simple_illegal_acts.description: Harvest area without waiting for heritage clearance
simple_illegal_acts.story: Archaeological assessment has been pending for 6 months. Your crew leader suggests just proceeding - 'what they don't know won't hurt them'.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Dump Equipment Fluids
simple_illegal_acts.description: Illegally dispose of hydraulic fluid and oil in forest
simple_illegal_acts.story: Proper disposal of equipment fluids costs $85K. A mechanic offers to 'handle disposal' by dumping everything in a remote clearcut.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Forge Safety Training Records
simple_illegal_acts.description: Create fake safety certification documents for workers
simple_illegal_acts.story: Safety training costs are eating profits. A consultant offers to provide 'complete' safety records for all workers without actual training.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Bribe Local Permit Officer
simple_illegal_acts.description: Pay regional official to fast-track permit applications
simple_illegal_acts.story: The local permit officer hints that $25K could ensure your applications get priority processing while competitors wait months.

simple_illegal_acts.name: High-Grade Only the Best Trees
simple_illegal_acts.description: Selectively harvest only premium logs, leaving slash and small trees
simple_illegal_acts.story: Focus only on high-value old growth and premium logs. Leave the rest as 'wildlife trees' even though your permit requires full harvest.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Falsify Silviculture Reports
simple_illegal_acts.description: Report tree planting and maintenance that was never done
simple_illegal_acts.story: Submit fake silviculture reports claiming you planted and tended seedlings. Government inspections are rare in remote areas.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Harvest During Wildlife Closure
simple_illegal_acts.description: Continue operations during seasonal wildlife protection periods
simple_illegal_acts.story: Caribou calving season shuts down operations for 2 months. Continue harvesting in 'uninhabited' areas to meet contract deadlines.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Modify Equipment Emission Controls
simple_illegal_acts.description: Remove emissions equipment to increase equipment power and fuel efficiency
simple_illegal_acts.story: Removing emissions controls increases equipment power 15% and saves $120K annually in fuel costs. Inspections are infrequent.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Use Banned Herbicides
simple_illegal_acts.description: Apply cheaper prohibited chemicals for vegetation management
simple_illegal_acts.story: Banned herbicides are 70% cheaper and more effective than approved alternatives. A supplier offers 'no questions asked' bulk chemicals.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Exceed Truck Weight Limits
simple_illegal_acts.description: Overload logging trucks to reduce transportation costs
simple_illegal_acts.story: Loading trucks 20% over weight limit reduces trips by 20%. Most weigh scales are predictable and avoidable.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Sell Timber to Black Market
simple_illegal_acts.description: Sell premium logs to unregistered mills at higher prices
simple_illegal_acts.story: Unregistered mills pay 30% above market rates for premium logs. No paperwork, no stumpage tracking, cash payments.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Fake First Nations Consultation
simple_illegal_acts.description: Forge consultation documents claiming Indigenous agreement
simple_illegal_acts.story: Create fake meeting minutes and agreements to satisfy consultation requirements. Avoid actual negotiations that could delay operations.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Harvest Crown Land Without Permits
simple_illegal_acts.description: Cut valuable timber on adjacent Crown land assuming no one will notice
simple_illegal_acts.story: Crown land boundaries are poorly marked. Extend harvest into valuable adjacent stands and claim 'boundary confusion' if caught.

simple_illegal_acts.name: Dispose of Asbestos Insulation Illegally
simple_illegal_acts.description: Bury old camp building asbestos instead of proper hazmat disposal
simple_illegal_acts.story: Demolishing old camp buildings reveals asbestos insulation. Proper disposal costs $75K. Just bury it deep in a remote clearcut.

complex_operations.name: The CRA Deception Network
complex_operations.description: Multi-year tax evasion scheme using shell companies and offshore accounts
complex_operations.story: A forensic accountant with mob connections offers to set up an elaborate tax evasion network. Start small with simple deductions, escalate to offshore money laundering.

stages.name: Stage 1: Creative Deductions
stages.description: Inflate equipment costs and claim personal expenses as business costs
stages.story: Start with 'aggressive' but seemingly legitimate tax strategies. Claim your truck, cottage, and family vacations as business expenses.

stages.name: Stage 2: Shell Company Network
stages.description: Create fake consulting companies to shift profits and avoid taxes
stages.story: Set up 3 shell companies that 'provide consulting services' to your forestry operation. Channel profits through these companies to avoid corporate tax.

stages.name: Stage 3: Offshore Banking
stages.description: Move profits to Cayman Islands accounts to avoid all Canadian taxes
stages.story: Open accounts in the Cayman Islands. Route all major contracts through offshore companies. CRA has limited ability to track foreign accounts.

stages.name: Stage 4: International Money Laundering
stages.description: Partner with international criminal organizations to clean massive profits
stages.story: The accountant introduces you to Eastern European crime syndicates. They'll launder unlimited money for 15% commission. No questions asked.

complex_operations.name: The Timber Revenue Phantom
complex_operations.description: Systematically under-report timber sales to avoid stumpage fees and income tax
complex_operations.story: Your mill contact suggests under-reporting actual timber volumes and prices. Start with small discrepancies, escalate to completely fake invoicing systems.

stages.name: Stage 1: Volume Underreporting
stages.description: Report 20% less volume than actually harvested
stages.story: Simple scale manipulation. Report 80,000m3 when you actually harvested 100,000m3. Saves massive stumpage fees.

stages.name: Stage 2: Price Manipulation
stages.description: Create fake lower-price contracts while receiving higher payments under the table
stages.story: Mills officially pay you $70/m3 but secretly add $25/m3 in cash payments. Government only sees the $70 rate for tax purposes.

stages.name: Stage 3: Double-Invoice System
stages.description: Maintain completely separate accounting systems for real vs reported sales
stages.story: Two complete sets of books. Official records show modest profits. Real records show you're making 3x more than reported to CRA.

stages.name: Stage 4: Cryptocurrency Conversion
stages.description: Convert all unreported profits to Bitcoin to hide wealth permanently
stages.story: Convert all hidden cash to Bitcoin through untraceable exchanges. Wealth becomes virtually impossible for CRA to discover or seize.

complex_operations.name: The Cocaine Highway Express
complex_operations.description: Use logging roads and equipment to transport drugs across Canada-US border
complex_operations.story: Colombian cartel contacts you through a mutual 'friend'. They need remote transportation corridors. Start with small loads, build to major trafficking operation.

stages.name: Stage 1: Single Load Test
stages.description: Transport one 50kg cocaine shipment hidden in logging truck
stages.story: Prove reliability with one test shipment. $500K for driving a truck from the border to Vancouver. What could go wrong?

stages.name: Stage 2: Regular Smuggling Route
stages.description: Establish weekly shipments using modified logging equipment
stages.story: Build hidden compartments in logging trailers. Weekly runs carrying 200kg per trip. Cartel provides protection and logistics.

stages.name: Stage 3: Distribution Network
stages.description: Use your worker network to distribute drugs throughout BC interior
stages.story: Recruit desperate workers as dealers. Control distribution from Prince George to Kamloops. Massive profits but workers become liabilities.

stages.name: Stage 4: International Cartel Partnership
stages.description: Become Canadian distribution hub for South American drug cartels
stages.story: Full partnership with Colombian cartels. Move 2 tonnes monthly. $50M+ annual revenue but you're now a major international criminal.

complex_operations.name: The Toxic Waste Empire
complex_operations.description: Become illegal toxic waste disposal site for industries across Western Canada
complex_operations.story: Chemical companies desperately need somewhere to dump toxic waste. Your remote forestland could be worth millions as an illegal dump site.

stages.name: Stage 1: Industrial Sludge Disposal
stages.description: Accept contaminated soil and industrial sludge for 'disposal'
stages.story: Chemical companies pay $200/tonne to dump contaminated soil. Just bury it in remote clearcuts. Easy money.

stages.name: Stage 2: Hazardous Chemical Storage
stages.description: Store banned pesticides and industrial chemicals in hidden bunkers
stages.story: Build underground storage for chemicals too dangerous for legal disposal. Pesticide companies pay millions to hide banned substances.

stages.name: Stage 3: Radioactive Waste Facility
stages.description: Accept low-level radioactive waste from medical and research facilities
stages.story: Hospitals and research labs generate radioactive waste. Legal disposal costs $50,000+ per container. You'll take it for $10,000.

stages.name: Stage 4: International Toxic Hub
stages.description: Accept toxic waste shipments from US and Asia via secret import network
stages.story: Partner with international waste brokers. Accept shipments from Asia and USA. Your land becomes North America's toxic dump.

complex_operations.name: The Government Takeover
complex_operations.description: Systematically corrupt BC government officials to control forestry policy
complex_operations.story: A lobbyist offers to 'influence' key government decision-makers. Start with small bribes, escalate to controlling entire ministries.

stages.name: Stage 1: Local Official Bribes
stages.description: Bribe regional forestry officials for permit advantages
stages.story: Start with regional permit officers. $20K per official ensures your permits get approved first while competitors wait.

stages.name: Stage 2: Ministry Infiltration
stages.description: Place paid agents in key positions within BC Ministry of Forests
stages.story: Fund sympathetic candidates for senior ministry positions. $300K investment gets you inside information and policy influence.

stages.name: Stage 3: Legislative Control
stages.description: Bribe MLAs to vote for forestry-friendly legislation
stages.story: Buy votes in the BC Legislature. $50K per MLA ensures favorable forestry legislation. Control environmental and indigenous policies.

stages.name: Stage 4: Premier's Office
stages.description: Corrupt the Premier's Chief of Staff to control provincial policy
stages.story: The ultimate prize: the Premier's Chief of Staff. $1M secures unprecedented policy control but exposes you to federal investigation.

bribery_layers.name: Bribe investigating officers
bribery_layers.warning: Bribing police officers is a serious federal crime

bribery_layers.name: Bribe senior officials
bribery_layers.warning: Corrupting senior officials triggers federal investigations

bribery_layers.name: Political protection network
bribery_layers.warning: Political corruption at this level makes you an enemy of the state
